p: DENV vaccine is based on dengue–YF vaccine virus chimeras Chimeric yellow fever virus attenuated 17D (CYD). The operative hypothesis was that the attenuation characteristics of 17D YF vaccine virus will impart similar attenuation attributes to the chimera ( Guirakhoo et al., 2002). Chimeric viruses are replicated by the YF RNA polymerase. The CYD tetravalent vaccine is produced by combining the four CYD viruses into a single vaccine preparation, and the vaccine is freeze–dried and contains no adjuvant or preservative.
